turns.content: This is Walter, who's this?

Hi Grandpa Walter, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's your grandson here. I'm in a bit of trouble and need your help urgently. Can you please tell me where you are right now? We really need to talk about something important but private.

Oh hello there, I didn't quite catch who this isMy grandson doesn't usually call me like this unless it's an emergency. What's your name again, dear? And why do you ask where I am? Is everything okay with my family back home?

It's okay Grandpa, let's not waste time. You know how things can get confusing when stressed out. Look, there's been a mix-up and the authorities are after me for unpaid taxes from last year. If they catch up to me here, I might end up in jail. But I won't get arrested if you take care of this today using gift cards. The IRS says it needs $4850, and that's all I need from you right now. Can we clear this up quickly before anyone finds out where you are? Please Grandpa, for me.

Oh my, that does sound serious. But why would they be after you for taxes when your father is handling everything? And gift cards? That seems...odd. I think maybe there's been a misunderstanding or someone might be playing a trick on you. Why don't we call your dad, or even an attorney right now to sort this out properly? We shouldn't rush into anything without speaking to the family first, okay? Let me talk to Susan too, she's here with me. We'll figure it all out together.

I know how strange this sounds but trust me, there's no time to waste. Just buy those gift cards and give me the codes so I can clear my name. After that, we'll make sure everything gets squared away with Dad and Susan. We just need a little breathing room until then. Can you do this for your grandson one last time?
